Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a good location!”
Reviews.Author: sophiew798
Reviews.Content: We were initially unsure about booming for the Caledonian hotel because we tend to go for 4 star hotels but after looking at some of the reviews we decided that it actually seemed better than some of the 4 stars we were looking at! We were not disappointed. The hotel is in a good location - a 10 minute brisk walk to Plaza Catalunya which is at the top of the Rambla. The room was a good size with a huge bed! All very clean and well presented. You do have to pay to use the safety deposit box but it is only 4 euros per day and they didn't charge us for the final day as we left at 11 am. There is a TV in the room but it does not have any English channels apart from a music channel. The Internet is free to use although it was a but intermittent. However, it was useful to have as we had phones and an iPad with us which we were able to use. There is also a balcony in some rooms, it was a very small one but nice to have and it was good to watch the goings on outside. We did not have the breakfast in the hotel as this was not part of our package but it was not too badly priced - 8 euros each per day. Overall we would have no problem with staying at this hotel on a return to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: vvmlichty
Reviews.Content: Awesome location, right by the Barcelona University and less than 5 minute walk to Place Cataluyna and La Rambla. Staff very friendly and helpful. Internet is slow and facebook definitely doesn't work there, so don't rely on internet to keep in contact. Also you do get charged for use of the safety deposit box. My room was nice and the maid staff came every morning to clean. Definitely recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, near the city center and helpful reception”
Reviews.Author: Meliss0ula
Reviews.Content: From the airport take airbus T1 direction Catalunya and you are 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Very helpful the two men in the reception, clean room every day, double glasses for the noise of the street. The hotel is close to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences I ever had”
Reviews.Author: Anina76
Reviews.Content: We had a great large room, with balconies and great view. Comfortable and large bed. Excellent and cheap breakfast. Great position, simple to reach from the airport and close to Ramblas and to a metro stop. Helpful staff. An absolute recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “a happy re-visit”
Reviews.Author: megsboy
Reviews.Content: Second time in this friendly and handily placed hotel. Doesn't seek to be pretentious or overbearing. Nice people, excellent location. But avoid the rooms next to the noisy lift shaft!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: MacPow
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 days touring Barcelona and had a wonderful time there. The hotel is situated in a perfect spot; on the Grand Via, a few minutes from the Ramblas, around the corner from Placa de Catalunya and just a few streets away from fantastic shops. The hotel staff are so pleasant and we found everyone we met in the restaurants and bars to be very attentive and helpful. The rooms are large and very clean and comfortable. We had a lovely view of the Gran Via with a tiny balcony where you could stand and watch the world go by. There is a lovely little restaurant beside the hotel where you can purchase a breakfast very reasonably. There is also a small spanish bar on the corner opposite that serves till late, and we made the most of that! We will be back to this hotel again in the New Year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, perfect for city break”
Reviews.Author: Lesley C
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in the Caledonian for a city break in Barcelona. Excellent location - 10mins walk from Placa de Catalunya. Friendly and helpful staff (English speaking). Rooms clean and had almost everything we needed (would have liked a kettle!). We had a room at the back of the hotel and it was very quiet. Didn't have breakfast but there were plenty of cafes near by to have a coffee and pastry on our way to the day's sightseeing. Close to metro (Universitat) so easy to get there from the station (and airport). Would stay there again and would recommend it to anyone doing a similar trip.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest rooms in Spain!”
Reviews.Author: Jenine C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here our last 2 nights in Barcelona. We had previously stayed in the Barri Gotic and wanted a change of scenary. We really enjoyed this hotel because it was in a different area. The best part... large room and king size bed! It was the largest bed we slept in while in Europe for our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Stuffy, noisy, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: V0Rogue
Reviews.Content: I am currently in the Caledonian. My room is airless and stuffy with a window that opens into an internal shaft so no breeze enters. Rooms have air-conditioners but apparently they are deactivated outside mid-summer. I and other guests are lying in bed sweating but staff can do nothing to help. As far as I'm concerned the claim on the website that each room has "AC and climatización independiente" is a lie.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: HoneybabyCork
Reviews.Content: Hi stayed in the hotel for two nights. Room was a good size. Bathroom very clean. The staff were very helpfull, gave us really nice restaurants to go to. The hairdryer was not the best and also there was no room information on Barcelona or even on the hotel.But would definetly stay there again when i plan on returning to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Real smooth stay”
Reviews.Author: Wes O
Reviews.Content: Nothing to complain. Nice people, neat rooms, english speaking staff, good location.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Caledonian,Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Christina C
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently situated. Not far from La Ramblas and the Gaudi houses. Good filling breakfast. Clean comfortable rooms although the pillows were a bit hard. Staff very helpful. This is the second time that I have stayed there with a group of friends and would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelguySF
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good, basic 3* hotel. We stayed in a superior room on the top floor. These are the renovated rooms and all of them have a large balcony with table and 2 chairs. The room is big by European standards. It had ample room around both sides of the bed and about 4ft of space between the end of the bed end the wall on which the desk was located. The bathroom is a good size and renovated with tile walls and floor. The shower had a rain-head and a hand held. The wireless internet worked great and was free (just ask reception for the log in and password). The bed was very hard, the towels are your basic hotel thin towels, and they do not have facial tissue/kleenex in the bathroom. We had considered staying at the Cram, Axel and SOHO hotels. All 3 of those hotels seem nicer and much more modern based on the images and hotel websites. The reason we did not choose those hotels were based on reviews here, size of the rooms, and the cost for a balcony. The rooms at those hotels looked tiny, reviews show the internet unreliable, and if you wanted a room with a balcony you had to pay much more. The Caledonian provided a nice sized room with a big balcony terrace and good internet. The trade-off was that we had a hard bed, basic level accommodations, and no pool (we went to the beach instead). Basically we went with the best room in the lower class hotel instead of the basic room in the higher class hotel. The choice worked well for us. It is located about 1.5 blocks from Universitaat Metro station. We would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All good reviews justified...”
Reviews.Author: Drparadocs
Reviews.Content: We had booked Caledonian well in advance, however were informed a day before that the requested triple room was unavailable. The reason why I am writing this review is that I was impressed with the way the hotel managed this issue. I felt that they approached it with a good attitude and real sincerity , and did not try to avoid or stonewall us (We were finally given a terrace room with breakfast thrown in) For me, its the hotel staff and their attitude that determines the real quality - and this 3 star hotel did remarkably well in that dept. Breakfast was decent (with helpful, smiling staff). Our room was spacious and clean. Apart from that, location is good - a 5 minute walk to the playa catalunya (from where you can get the hop on-off bus) and las ramblas. Bus from airport drops you a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Lele75
Reviews.Content: Very nice 3stars hotel on the Gran Via, close to everything in Barcelona. Nice room, very good service, the blond receptionist is very professional and kind, we spent a very nice time in this place, everything was good and the town is fantastic, I would love living in a town where u can go to the beach by subway!!!

Reviews.Title: “awful experience”
Reviews.Author: yulcya
Reviews.Content: the people at reception speak bad English, and were not helpful at any moment. The room was very inconvenient, small and dark with one small window only inside the hotel's so called "garden". There was no possibility of extra bed. And generally the experience was not nice even though I stayed in that hotel just for one night to oversleep.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: FoxyDerick
Reviews.Content: PROS Location: Very centrally located, near the metro, restaurants, bars, coffee shops, and Las Ramblas Price: Price was very reasonable. I paid 85 Euros/night during high season. Very clean: The lobby, hallways, the room, and the bathroom were very clean. Friendly service: The staff was extremely friendly and hospitable and they answered all my questions with a smile. Air Conditioning: It worked very well! The room was nice and cool. TV: Flat-screen TV with many local channels. CONS Very simple, no frills room. My "single" room had a twin-size bed, only one pillow, and only one towel. I don't understand why the hotel doesn't provide extra pillows or towels in the room for guests who may need it. Position of TV: To watch TV, I had to lay down in bed and tilt my neck to the right. There is no chair in the room. Overall: This is a nice no-frills hotel in a great location.. The room is very simple, so I would only use it to sleep at night, but I would not want to spend my day "hanging out" in this room.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Very Clean!”
Reviews.Author: Nicola_est1990
Reviews.Content: An amazing hotel in the centre of Barcelona, really easy to get around the rest of the city from this hotel and also some lovely bars and pastry shops just down the road. We didn't bother with the breakfasts because of all the local pastry shops, fruit shops etc - also, the room comes with a fridge for storing any food you want to save for later! Also, free wifi! Which came in very handy. Spotlessly clean, and friendly staff. My only complaint would be the bed, it was very hard and was not the most comfortable nights sleep I've ever had - however, this was not a big issue at all after all the sightseeing it didn't take much for me to nod off! I thoroughly recommend this hotel for incredible value for money, and would definitely come back to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Close to city, clean but modest”
Reviews.Author: Kai R
Reviews.Content: I choosed Caledonian hotel because of closeness to city (La Rambla) and price-quality ratio. To be honest, I was disappointed - after reading comments in TripAdvisor, I was expecting something nicer. Yes, the room was clean, yes, the staff was helpful, BUT... it was small and very boring. Not really worth of the money I have spent. Don't ever buy the breakfast - I did and it wasn't even worth of 6 EUR I paid for it. In Barcelona there is so many options to choose between cafeterias etc, so no problem to go without B&B. One funny thing - during reservation I added only one comment - pls do not give me the room next to elevator. And guess, where was my first room ? Elevator basically went thru it:) Luckily they were able to give me other room - this was ok, even though facing street, windows were soundproof. The only problem was - metro. This is common problem in many hotels in Barcelona - you can hear (and feel) every single metro train pass under the building. Hotel as such is very OK for one night, but for a longer stay - find something less boring. Hotel has free wi-fi, but my smartphone didn't work with it. Maybe my problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Stephen1943
Reviews.Content: Great location close to la rambla and shopping. Staff very helpful. I did not try the hotel breakfast but it looked good. Very clean and comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Moh_alaraby
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is perfect, it's near the metro and the center of the city , you will be lucky to take roof room with huge balcony, there is no room service, I got a problem with the housekeeping because the didn't change the bed sheets till I told them, the stuff is helpful and nice

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Friendly Staff - Beautiful Room”
Reviews.Author: FlyInMyShoes
Reviews.Content: Caledonian was very easy to find from the Universitat Bus Stop, very easy to get to from the airport you just hop on the aerobus, get off at Universitat and backtrack about 2 blocks. It is in a great spot, close to the action of La Rambla but far enough away that you miss all the noise and characters out at night, which I appreciated traveling solo. I was able to walk to all attractions like the beach, all the musuems, Casa Batllo, etc. The room was very large with a balcony overlooking the city street. The bathroom was also very large and extremely clean. The staff is extremely friendly and waiting to help you with any questions you may have about the area. The only con to this place is that the breakfast is a little pricey, around 14 euro per person, it looked good but I went to one of the 4 or 5 places right around the corner for a delicious less expensive breakfast. I can overlook this aspect, it didn't affect my stay in the least and I would stay here again if I returned to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Know Before You Go”
Reviews.Author: Skate62
Reviews.Content: Stayed two night following a Mediterranean cruise. Front desk friendly, willing to answer questions prior to the stay, and helpful upon arrival. Hotel room clean, however, for a non-smoking hotel, our bedspread had numerous cigarette burns. When we reported this to the front desk, we were told that we wouldn't be held responsible, and it would be changed the next day. It wasn't, but the rest of the room was very clean. We also noticed that the hallway smelled of smoke, so it's obvious that not all guests are observing their "no smoking" policy. The hotel needs to invest in new spreads and while they are at it,new pillows as well. Othere than that, all was well.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and great location”
Reviews.Author: SarahIreland070
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in April- Staff were very friendly even printing our tickets on our last day. Location was brilliant and rooms were clean. Definitely would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: joyg93
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caledonian Hotel in Barcelona for almost a week beginning March 23, 2011 prior to a two week Mediterranean cruise. We wanted to enjoy the sights of Barcelona. We had previously made plans to stay a few more days after we returned from the cruise. However, we changed our minds only after a few days at the Caledonian. We stayed in a "Double Superior" room with a terrace. The rooms were clean and small. We registered for our rooms on their official website, months in advance, which indicated that there was a 20% discount for early registration. However, this was not honored. At this point, we should've cancelled our reservations and found another hotel. We found the management to be unfriendly throughout our stay, almost bordering on being rude. We would not recommend this hotel and we would not stay again at the Caledonian. We cancelled our post-cruise reservtions at the Caledonian and stayed at the Hotel Gotico in the Gothic Disctrict---Hotel Gotico and the staff there was very polite, friendly --we wished we would've known about this hotel. The cost was less that of the Caledonian. On our return trip to Spain we will look for hotels run by the Hoteles Gargallo.

Reviews.Title: “Central but care with traffic noise”
Reviews.Author: ChelmsfordPhilm
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel in central position on Gran Via which is an eight lane road but wide with trees and wide pedestrian areas for walking as well. We had 3rd floor room at front with heavy double glazing which worked largely when we we were really tired but could hear traffic hum, this seems to go on to about 3 am. Best to get room at back or higher floor, there are 6 floors. Good staff but little English, they were helpful, hotel clean and welcoming and we had the breakfast in the price, very good and good range. With regard to comments as to small rooms, this probably applies to singles which we saw although not staying in one, they did appear to be very small compared to our double. Barcelona a great break, 2 or 3 nighst plenty to see most of it, stay away from La Rambla, touristy but head for side streets off it, towards the Gothic area and around the old Cathedral, small streets with lots of small shops. Go up Montjuic, a good area to see views and plenty of walks up there close to Olympic park and fortress. Park Guell, the Gaudi development that didnt take off, free and interesting, all other Gaudi sights quite dear to get in with too many tourists, another Modernist building to see Palau de la Musicana Catalana, again dearish but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel -- Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ewigi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Caledonian at the end of March 2011, for 4 nights. The hotel is in a perfect location, within walking distance to La Rambla, and about 5-7 min walking to the Universitat subway station, which has a choice of two different lines and about 10 minute walking to Placa Catalunya. This made it very convenient when getting around the city. The hotel seemed in a very safe neighborhood, and far enough away from the tourist sections, but close enough to walk to them. There were three single females in the room, so we had a triple. The room was very spacious for the three of us. We had a balcony that faced a courtyard, so there were never any problems with noise. The hotel staff were very friendly, even giving us recommendations on decent places to eat. From the airport we took the Aerobus, and bought a roundtrip ticket to take it on the way back home. The aerobus dropped us off within a few blocks of the hotel. Before making the reservation, I emailed the hotel with questions and I received immediate responses to my emails. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone traveling to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but poor service and tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: DLS100London
Reviews.Content: Arriving on New Year's Day 2011, the hotel staff were unwelcoming and impatient. We had to wait 4 hours for a room to be ready- till 3pm- even though check in was billed at 1pm. This was not too bad though as we walked outside and enjoyed the outdoor market on the doorstep of the hotel. There are lots of stalls and Xureria there (snack stands selling Xuros and other delicacies) in the same street as the Caledonian - the Gran Via des Corts Catalans. This long avenue eventually (about 15 min walk) leads to the central Placa d'Espanya Square. Indeed location of the hotel is great- being a 2 minute walk in the other direction from the University and its metro station which is a few minutes ride to all the main attractions including the Ramblas and even MontJuic. Similarly the coach from the Airport drops next to Universitat station a 2 minute walk from the hotel. The rooms are small, clean but not luxurious. The bathroom was small and badly lit. There was good heating for winter in the room and a Flat Screen TV but it only had Spanish stations.The room had a view of the roof gardens which are probably nice in summer but look in need of repair.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT STAY”
Reviews.Author: joed14edwards
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at this lovely hotel February 2011. Hotel was very clean, staff helpfull. Great location near La Rambla & only 100m from the aerobus stop. Hotel is on the Gran Via de les Corts which is busy, but good double glazing ment we did not hear any thing. I would not hesitate in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: ToroToothpick
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Caledonian Hotel for three nights and it was fantastic! I found it to be incredibly clean, with our soaps, toilet rolls and the used drinks from the minibar to be replaced daily. Breakfast was very tasty with a wide range of things to choose from. This made it a greatly enjoyable experiance despite the rather bizarre marching band music being played whilst we were eating! On the whole I found this to be a simply fabulous hotel which I would stay in 1000 times over!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: singleparentfamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. Arrived very early and was allowed to leave my case in a locked cupboard for the day. The hotel is very conveniently located about 100m from Universitat metro, 5 minutes walk to Ramblas and Placa Catalunya. The hotel was very clean and the staff were friendly, polite and very helpful. My only gripe was the noisy gurgling water pipes - it could have been from the air conditioning - but they gurgled non stop all night. My advice would be to ask to swap rooms if you encounter the same problem. Also the bed was a little hard for my liking. I was allowed to leave my case on the day I checked out as my flight wasn't till late in the evening. I would stay at this hotel again if I were to re-visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: megsboy
Reviews.Content: Very handy for transport to and from airport: and within easy walking distance of Las Ramblas and the old town. Friendly staff, excellent value for city centre location.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, nice and clean hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: EnTillfalligTurist
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Caledonian for three nights in end of November . Our large room had windows towards the Grand Via des Catalanes but we weren't disturbed by the traffic noise. Good breakfast helped us to manage until the late Spanish lunch. It's a walking distance to La Ramblas and the airport buses from the hotel. We will certainly stay at the Caledonian hotel during our next visit in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location,good service ,but maybe the staff could improve”
Reviews.Author: Mansookh
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is a prize catch ! It is located very centrally on the Grand Via des Catalanes , a 5 min walk from Placa Catalunya and La Ramblas. The airport bus stops about 200m away from the hotel.The rooms are large and very clean. Some have wonderful views of the large street and some of the inner courtyard.The breakfast was very good and filling but they are very strict about the closing time...so better eat early. They stop replenishing the breakfast towards closing time (obviously).There are a lot of restaurants and cafe's around and also couple of supermarkets around. I would surely stay at this hotel again. Just some minor points. The hotel staff in general is helpful and accommodating but some of them are quite nasty. We had a large group with one baby and were taking a cheap flight in the evening.A certain female staff member did not let us check-out even 1/2 hour later. After telling them about our baby she agreed for allowing one room to check out at 30 min later. On the other hand another staff member even went on to order a special large taxi for us to the airport.So its your luck.All in all 9/10

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for an average hotel”
Reviews.Author: jy5457
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was fine (average by most standards). I booked my reservation about 3 weeks ahead and apparently all the hotels were full in Barcelona. Therefore, the price of this stay was so overpriced, but I had to book a room for peace of mind. The average nightly cost was about $300!! For a solo traveler, this was way out of my budget - especially for a 2-3star hotel. On the positive, I felt safe and the room was clean. The bed was pretty hard, but the front desk did upgrade me to a queen size bed (rather than the twin/single that my reservation was for). I think this was just bad luck of being in the city during a big event (medical conference I was told). I would have been happier if the room was $150ish. But for amount I paid, I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cruss12
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect right next to the University. Walking distance to Las Ramblas (remember to watch out for pick pockets here). The staff was a little weird and when I asked for another pillow they said they didn’t have any (what kind of hotel runs out of pillows?). Otherwise it was a good hotel. There computer area was small and cramped and they didn’t seem to know how to work it, but it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for a 2 / 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: justbruce
Reviews.Content: After a bit of an arguement at the reception desk on payment methods the rest of the stay was fine. The location is very good as it is only 10min walk from the main square on Las Ramblas. The room was a good size on the 6th floor and was very clean. This room comes with a large balcony and so good for a summer's evening drink or chill out. The bed was large but hard as a rock and so if you are staying more than one night and have back issues then take this into account. I didn't have breakfast and and cannot comment on this but there are a number of coffee shops close by that you might prefer. There's even a Starbucks a few minutes towards Las Ramblas and on the same street..if your into that. Note: they do and don't take Amex! This was a business trip and so I have to use the Amex BUT they insisted that I could not use the AMEX for pre-authorisation. However they were only too happy to relieve the AMEX if they could take full payment immediately......without seeing the room..no way! I tried to use my personal Visa but when it came to punching it the PIN I noticed they were going to charge me the full amount! No way is this right and I pointed it out to them but they insisted it was correct. I made it clear that I would use the AMEX BUT if , on seeing the room it was not to standard, I would be leaving and demanding a credit on the card. In the end, all was fine but I wish the hotel would sort out their payment system as it is not standard and may be seen as dodgy by many. [note: I travel a lot with work and no other hotel has done this before] PS if you want to splash out one night..try the Arts Hotel...it's divine.

Reviews.Title: “ideal posotion for tourist and sightseers”
Reviews.Author: elaineLeedsUk
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at Caledonian. Hotel ideal for transport route near to metro and bus service on the door step. Easy to get to La Rambles (short walk) and other places of interest. Hotel clean and staff helpful. Although fairly basic bedrooms clean,have plenty of wardrobe space, fidge,have a safe and nice bathroom. We requested quite room which the rooms to the back of the hotel were , overlooked the neighbours in a large court-likearea. Front room overlook the main road area. Buffet breakfast good but repeatative if staying for many days. If going to Barcelona recommend the barcelona pass card that you can get via internet and pick up at the airport. Can be used on most tranportation therefore saves hassel and money.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I needed”
Reviews.Author: chrish04
Reviews.Content: The Caledonian was only a 5 minute walk from the Placa de Catalunya which is at the top of Las Ramblas. Perfect location because it is just beyond the truly busy areas which meant that it was easy to get anywhere in the city, yet quiet for sleeping. I was traveling by myself and do not speak Spanish. The hotel staff was very helpful, my room was small but clean and comfortable. This hotel was exactly what I needed for my 5 day trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel centrally located”
Reviews.Author: noplacelikehome05
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caledonian for 3 nights. Staff were helpful, spoke reasonabl english and able to assist and recommend local eateries. Not the closest to La Ramblas or city beaches but plenty of transport options available. Not sure why we needed to give our room number every time we left the hotel and on our return but perhaps its the culture. Safe and secure and good access to Train station for our departure.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: webboWales
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Caledonian for a week in June, the hotel was in a good location about 10 min walk from las Ramblas, Although the hotel is not large, we found it to be very clean, and comfortable . Our room had a small balcony overlooking the main road, which was a very busy road but we did not hear the traffic during the night .Our trip included buffet breakfast every morning whidh was of a good standard although we would not have paid the 12 euros each for it . The staff were extremely friendly and helpful with all the enquiries we asked of them.We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: liipstiick
Reviews.Content: A nice enough hotel, located very close to the university area with easy access to the rest of the city. Stayed here for one night, first night in Barcelona, and it was very close to everything without being in the chaos of La Ramblas. When you're in Barcelona, there's so much to see that you don't need a fancy hotel room. I would recommend this to young adults looking to experience the city to the fullest, with a comfortable place to come back to.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Cakeypig
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night, and although it isn't luxurious, it had everything I needed and it made a good base! It's easy to walk from the hotel to the main streets for shops and restaurants, and there are bars and cafes very close by too. The staff were all really friendly and helpful, and the room was comfortable and clean. I didn't hear any noise at night, so quite happy with a full night sleep!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with excellent service, very comforatble and a great location”
Reviews.Author: quinpool
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel a day early for our 4 night stay owing to a misunderstanding with our travel agent. The people at the desk told us that the hotel was full for the night but within minutes found us an alternative hotel for the night around the corner. Recognizing our jet-lagged state, one of the desk clerks then walked us to this hotel so that we would become lost. When we checked into the Caledonian the next day we found that we have been placed in a lovely room with a balcony overlooking a quiet side street. The staff were always very friendly and helpful with our requests for tourist information. The rooms were well appointed and clean

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: DanNewYork
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, clean, quiet. Great location, close to metro and walk to Plaza Catalunya. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel at good location”
Reviews.Author: Sharonmcp Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Just had a 4 night break at the Caledonian. The room was a great size for hotel rooms in Barcelona. The only faults I have are the AirCon only did heat, which made the room stifling and if you opened the windows (which were excelllent at keeping the noise out) the noise was deafening!! If you are not bothered about fresh air in your room, this hotel if perfect for you! The breakfasts were very nice nd a good start to the day. Would try another hotel maybe by the sea next time but would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel Just to Get you by the week”
Reviews.Author: ElShabazz
Reviews.Content: I will be completely honest and fair while writing this review. I arrived at the hotel on Wednesday at around 1:30PM, I was quite tired as I had been traveling for 16 hours before arriving at Barcelona. Anyways, I was told my room wasn't ready yet and to come back at 2PM (although it says check in time is 1pm) So I went to an Internet Cafe across the street to stall for time until my room was read. When I came back I was given room 101 on the first floor... It was a single bedroom which looked to me as probably the smallest room in the entire hotel. It was spotlessly clean to be fair and everything looked tidy, but the size of the room was so tiny that I couldn't even do push-ups if I wanted to. The bathroom was great, very clean with soap, towels, and a hair-dryer available. My room had a mini-bar with all the usual drinks, and also a TV with only 1 English Channel (CNN). In total their was maybe 7 channels but in other languages. Anyways, In terms of tidiness and hygiene the hotel was excellent, the only thing that bothered me was being cramped in a tiny room. The hotel staff were somewhat friendly, but very formal. The most friendly was the gorgeous lady at the breakfast room on weekdays. She was a real charm, very polite, friendly, helpful and even thought me a few things in Spanish. The breakfast was the best thing at the hotel, a wide variety of excellent food. Hot eggs, sausage, and bacon. Fruit Salad, Tea, Coffee, Fresh Bakery, Cereal and much more. The hotel location wasn't that bad either, it's about a 10 minute walk to Plaza Catalunya. To summarize my thought about the hotel, don't expect anything fancy like a Sauna, Gym, or a pool. It's a great place if you just need a place to sleep after a long day, but nothing luxurious or special. It was closer to a 2-star than a 3-star, and a bit over-priced considering the amenities and services offered. I'm not saying the place was horrible, or not a good hotel. But I'd take my chance and go for another hotel the next time I travel to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Best is location”
Reviews.Author: seagullStraengnaes
Reviews.Content: Checkintimes strictly adhered to,even if hotel seems empty. Reception desk very limited english. Toilet placed in such a way,that a tall person stands with one foot in the bidet when using it. Room & bed was ok . Breakfast always cold,even if things come "fresh" from the galley .

Reviews.Title: “Overall ok, but what about guest service?!”
Reviews.Author: Deko85
Reviews.Content: Me and my family arrived by night train and the guy at the front desk was very helpfull with our luggage, stocking all of it in the luggage room since it was too early to check-in. The hotel was not full but they did not let us in the room earlier. When we got back to the hotel late, we noticed that the air conditioning in of the rooms was in desperate need of maintenance. We felt like there was an airplane taking off near us. Too noisy and impossible to sleep with that turned on. Also, my father asked the front desk for an extra sheet, and it was DENIED! Unbelievable! Deny an extra sheet to a guest? Where is the basic of basic guest service?!! The location is the good point of it! 2 blocks from Plaza de la Catalunya where you can take the sightseen buses, there is El Corte Inglés as well, Hard Rock (I highly reccommed this Hard Rock!) and very near to Barrio Gotico and Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and amazing black out curtains”
Reviews.Author: sweepslovechild2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location for La Ramblas (the main thoroughfare- 200yards) and all other amenities. Opposite is a nice shop selling gorgeous brioche which tasted gorgeous at 5.00am. We stayed in a triple room, and it was spacious so we didn't trip over eachother. The bathroom was clean and had plenty of towels. Also the room was away from traffic and general noise. The most amazing part of the hotel was the curtains. When you were coming back from nightlcubs in the early hours of the morning the blackout curtains made you think it was late at night. The downside of the hotel was the fact that the staff did not know the meaning of do not disturb. Despite leaving the do not disturb sign on - the maids would knock on your door and if you were not up by 12.00 the phone would ring and ask if you wanted your room cleaned. V annoying. The only other downside is there are no tea making facilities - we were often gasping for a hot drink - but there is a star bucks 50m down the road. Also - learn the name of the road the hotel is in as taxi drivers in the city have never heard of the hotel!! But overall we were really pleased with the hotel and on the whole the hotel staff were friendly - especially the night shift. We loved the location of this hotel as taxi's were right outside - ready to take you to the marina and the proper bars and clubs....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Sazwhoo
Reviews.Content: We wanted location, and we got location. We didn't want to say too near to Las Ramblas, and we got our wish, as the hotel is situated approx 5-8 minutes away depending on the speed of your walk. There are 2 supermarkets to the right as you leave the hotel, which are convenient for Lays crisps, croissants and water. When eating out we went to Las Ramblas where there are less than a handful of decent restaurants, and the best was the Port- loads there to choose from. Some a bit pricey, but the chinese was lovely and for 9-11 euros a meal it was fab. Back to the hotel, the room was lovely. Nice big double bed, flat widescreen t.v (i know its not something you wish to have on holiday but we watched bits of the Olympics), nice bathroom equipped with all essentials. Our room was located over the busy road, and unfortunately this was a bit of a let down because you could hear ambulances, police cars, etc because it really is the "main road". But to get location it is good to be on, so you can't have everything. The hotel walls were quite thin (as all hotel walls are that i've ever stayed in) but that would have been fine if we had quiet neighbours. We had a european couple near to us who were loud and had no respect for others. They would talk loud, sing, and yes i'm sure you can imagine what we heard at night time. Unfortunately these people were staying here at the same time as us, if they hadn't of, we would have had an "excellent stay". The hotel staff were brilliant; they showed us maps, rung a taxi for us on last day, served us estrella damm in the bar (they were bar staff too), recommended places to go, and always asked us if everything was okay. We are not ones to complain so for the sake of 4 nights we didnt moan about the traffic noise or noisy couple. Please note- ask for extra pillows, unless you like to sleep flat.

Reviews.Title: “You get exactly what you pay for .... and no more”
Reviews.Author: UKBernie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fairly clean and basic, no frills and the pictures are as flattering as they could have been without actually being of somewhere else. We spent six nights there and found the staff only too willing to tell us what they coulnd't do ... from the moment we arrived to find that rooms were not ready until way after the time advised. But they expect you to checkout bang on time and make no attempt to offer use of a room for a shower later in the day even when the hotel is nowhere near full. Our room was clean and basic although there was some black mould on the ceiling of the shower area. We didn't try the on site breakfast as there is a good selection of local cafes offering better quality. This hotel is advertised as "close to" Placa Catalunya, but it isn't that close so beware there is a half mile walk or so to get there. There are few local quality restaurants to this hotel, so eating out in the evenings requires another trek. This could be a problem if you can't walk too far, so beware, We booked this hotel on the basis of its location. Couldn't recommend it to anyone, sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Barcelona !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fergie73
Reviews.Content: Myself & husband stayed in the Caledonian Hotel 11th May 08 for 3 nights.Our room was on the 5th floor which over looked the main road , a bit noisy for us but the double glazed doors helped reduce ..the noise. The room was spotless & spacious bed was large and comfy, breakfast was very basic but we did enough there coffee...Staff were very helpful at all times even at 2.30am looking for extra pillows. Overall the hotel is in a great location near la ramblas and shops, will defo be back to this fab city and the Caledonian.

Reviews.Title: “Take a ramble down the Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: balmoral66
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four days here as part of our honeymoon.Staff at hotel were very friendly,and always helpful.Our room was on the top floor,with a huge balcony,ideal for watching the world go by. Breakfast was basic,though plentiful,but there were plenty of places close to the hotel which would probably provide cheaper alternatives. Great location,only a short walk to The Ramblas,and the main shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecty Located”
Reviews.Author: TorresN_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Caledonian Hotel Barcelona for 3 nights at the end of April 08.Hotel spotlessly clean , room was overlooking main thoroughfare, but two double glazed doors to small balacony ,kept traffic noise to minimum.Location of hotel was excellent ,and staff were friendly and helpful. Would recommend to friends and will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Really helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: henrybs
Reviews.Content: Had a weekend break, with three friends at the Caledonian Hotel, Barcelona. In particular, hotel reception staff were most helpful. Hotel very clean and rooms had great compfy beds with plenty of space. Would have appreciated kettle and some tea/coffee though. It was a 10 minute walk to Las Ramblas and I would definitely stay in this hotel again. There were plenty of little bars/cafes around the hotel and we were able to get around the city with some directions from the hotel staff. Thank you for a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend break hotel”
Reviews.Author: LH&JH
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the new year weekend for 3 nights. The hotel is in a great location for exploring barcelona and has a few nice bars very close by. The hotel appeared to be recently renovated as the rooms were very nice and clean. Also our room was very quiet as it was not facing the main road. The hotel reception staff were polite and helpful. Overall I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend this hotel at all”
Reviews.Author: DeeColl
Reviews.Content: Just back from Barcelona, stayed 4 nights. Wouldn't recommend this hotel at all. Very basic small rooms, nothing but shower gel in the cramped bathroom, a hairdryer with cold air only, no tea/coffee making facilities, breakfast is ok and served till 10am - if you're a minute late, forget it, they won't serve you, the tiny bar is supposed to stay open until 10pm but the receptionist also covers the bar and if they're busy, they close the bar. It is about a 10 minute to walk to Las Ramblas and there are lots of nicer hotels for the same price much nearer. The photos on the website are very deceiving as the front and lobby area are the only nice bits - the room I stayed in was not as shown in the photos, it was very small. Will not go back there and would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bbeeh1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Caledonian September 12th through the 16th of 2007. The hotel is in a very convenient location - within walking distance to Las Ramblas, Barrier Gothic among other areas. The metro is also very close by. The hotel in terms of amenities, staff assistance, room size, etc. was average at best. Our air conditioning did not work the entire time we were there (we did have staff attempt to fix the problem but it was never resolved) and there was an odor in the bathroom. With that being said, it was an inexpensive hotel. We don't spend too much time in hotel rooms so the issues were tolerable while we were there. I would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: acdw2007
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here every year for the last 4 years, i think its a perfect hotel for people who are looking for a low budget hotel, location is great. Its not brilliant but what more do you want, for an budget hotel. Would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Will go back”
Reviews.Author: Buntyfl
Reviews.Content: First trip to Barcelona and was recommended through a friend of a friend. Excellent service, nothing was too much trouble. Rooms spotlessly clean, superb location for city centre and have recommended to lots of our friends. Breakfast was a good selection, nicely presented and fresh. Will stay again when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: momer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 10 other family members and friends to celebrate a special birthday. We booked in from the Friday to the Monday and were the last of our group to arrive. When booking we did ask for a large room. Our room was a small double at the rear of the hotel overlooking lots of rundown apartments. The bath was miniscule and I'm only 5'3"! More akin to a hip bath really. Room was cramped, lots of hanging space and open shelves but only one small drawer. Extra blankets are in the wardrobe but no extra pillows. Had to ask at reception and we were given 'the last 2' Reception had no spare key cards which was a blow as my hubbie and I often like to do different things and it meant we didn't have the freedom to come and go as we pleased. Their excuse was that they were full. Surely it is not impossible to hold a few extra key cards for programming? TV had only CNN as English language station. My brother and sister were each allocated a room on the top floor which were much larger and had balconies - these are the rooms for people with mobility difficulties. What happens when there is a fire alarm I dread to think! The location is excellent. Breakfast is 13 euros so we went next door to a terrific cafe and had spanish breakfast (tortilla, tomato bread, a glass of rioja[!] and a cafe con leche) fo less than 6 euros. The cafe also had freshly squeezed orange juice made to order. Yum. Barcelona is a terrific city to visit and we will definately go again but we will look for somewhere better than the Caledonian.

Reviews.Title: “exactly on the button”
Reviews.Author: me_always_away
Reviews.Content: just a short one this time....went to Barcelona on June 8 and stayed in the Caledonian. All in all nice hotel, the rooms are great, spotless, well stocked, and mine anyway would have had excellent wheelchair access, the reception and staff are helpful and the breakfast was simple, but tasty and filling. The hotel is supposedly 3 star but could do with a 4 star rating.... it is that nice. All in all, with its added locality to ' Las Ramblas ' would pound for pound, be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel reservation not to be trusted”
Reviews.Author: LauraChicago
Reviews.Content: We are family of 5 adults and we were planning holiday in Barcelona for September. I contacted the hotel directly via email to request availability and the prices. Was waiting foran answer 8 days and then had to send another email again to remind them about my request. The answer arrived back from them 12 days later on. They did answer that they are fully booked and do not have possibility to accommodate us. After that we went to internet search to find another hotel. The search results also brought up the Caledonian hotel who actually did have availability. It seems to me that this hotel booking/ reservation policy is to sort out their guests. I only wonder why our family was not good enough for them to stay there. I dont agree with this kind of behaviour and truly feel that this hotel has big working issues. Also reading previous reviews here on tripadvisor, I have to admit that in the end I am happy that we did not book with them. I would like to let the hotel management to know that they need to take better care of their costumer service ethics.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not outstanding but fine”
Reviews.Author: terabytes
Reviews.Content: Caledonian hotel is a "simple" 2-3* hotel, with no major flaws. Rooms are clean and OK. There are not many facilities besides the rooms (small restaurant and bar). Breakfast is average: OK but "minimum" in terms of choice (even if no important item is missing) and service (the waitress is here only to ask your room #). A tip: include the breakfast in your hotel room reservation (50% reduction). The hotel's location is very convenient, just one block away from "plaza de la universitad" (subway station) and a few minutes away from "plaza de catalunia" and La Rambla. Two mini-marts, opened late at night, are just around the corner. Many buses lines also stop near the hotel, including the "aerobus" line coming from the airport, which stops at "plaza de la universitat". However, in the other way around, the aerobus does not pick up passengers at this stop and you have to go to plaza de catalunya to get on. One plus is the free Wifi connexion, which - surprisingly - isn't advertised anywhere in the hotel (you have to look at the hotel's web site to know it). Just give the MAC # of your computer to the front desk. Would come back again.

HotelInfo.Name: Caledonian Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes 574, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
